intro: Andreettaea schudelii, commonly known as the Schudel's rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is native to South America. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, with small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
